# Home Improvement Contractor License (HIC)

Virginia Department of Professional and Occupational Regulation (DPOR) licensed Class “C” contractors and those performing work that does not meet the threshold for a Class “C” license must obtain a Fairfax County Home Improvement Contractor (HIC) license. 

## ON THIS PAGE

  * Who Should Apply?
  * Plan Ahead
  * How Do I Submit My Record?



  * Requirements
  * What's Next?
  * Additional Resources



_This information is the most common for how to obtain the necessary approval for your project and is not representative of all the conditions you may encounter._

## WHO SHOULD APPLY?

Contractors with a valid Virginia Department of Professional and Occupational Regulation (DPOR) Class “C” license, or contractors exempt from state licensing based on a contractual amount of less than $1,000.

  * Verify License on DPOR Website



## PLAN AHEAD

Before submitting, ensure you are aware of all applicable regulations and conditions that could affect your project to avoid surprises during the review process. Some of those factors include:

  * Contractor requirements in Fairfax County: Various licenses and other requirements must be met to legally operate as a contractor in Fairfax County. 
  * Design Codes and Standards
  * Do I need to hire a Registered Design Professional (RDP)?



To get a detailed description about each regulation and condition, visit our Plan Ahead page.

## HOW DO I SUBMIT MY RECORD?

### **PLUS Application**

Apply for your **Home Improvement Contractor License** online in PLUS under the **Building****** tab. If you are a first-time user, you must first register for an account.

### 

### **Instructional Videos for PLUS**

* * *

Need Help with PLUS? Visit Our LDS PLUS Support Page

## Requirements

### First Submission

The following items may be required with your HIC license application:

  * Record contacts must include: 
    * Applicant – individual applying for the license
    * Bond agent – supplying the surety bond described below
    * Business – company the individual is affiliated with
    * Two business references – customers who the applicant has worked for in the past
  * Virginia Contractors license number issued by the (DPOR), if applicable
  * Fairfax County Business, Professional and Occupational License (BPOL) number
  * Your standard contract template
  * Financial statement documenting business income from the past year
  * Surety bonds
    * Contracts _under_ $1,000 must have $5,000 surety bond
    * Contracts _over_ $1,000 must have a $10,000 surety bond
  * Upload a copy of the surety bond in PLUS and mail or deliver the original to:  
HIC Licenses  
12055 Government Center Parkway, Suite 334  
Fairfax, VA 22035



### Renewals

HIC licenses are valid for one to two years, depending on the length of the bond. To renew, log into PLUS and select “renewal” next to your HIC license number and follow the prompts. Renewals will require an updated surety bond and annual fee.




## What's Next?

### County Review and License Issuance

Staff from Land Development Services will review the application and attached documents. Once the HIC application has been accepted and original surety bond has been received, the applicant will receive an invoice to make a payment online. The license will be available to download from PLUS.

  * Fees
